heroDescription: Florence, Alabama, is a vibrant city known for its rich history and cultural heritage.
landscapeDescription: Florence's economy is diverse, with a strong emphasis on manufacturing, healthcare, and education. The city benefits from its strategic location along the Tennessee River.
uniqueNeeds: Florence requires strategies for economic diversification and disaster preparedness due to its geographic location.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Florence's manufacturing base poses economic risks; consider diversifying into tech and services. Real estate is vulnerable to market fluctuations and flooding risks.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Florence's economy has seen a steady growth rate of 2.5% over the past year, driven by manufacturing and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median household income in Florence is approximately $45,000, reflecting a modest economic landscape.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Florence are increasingly focusing on retirement planning and investment strategies tailored to local industries.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Florence's cost of living is 10% lower than the national average, making it an attractive location for families and retirees.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the real estate market in Florence has seen a 5% increase in home values over the past year, but concerns about affordability persist.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Florence's business climate is favorable, with incentives for new businesses and a supportive local government.
